results.name: Value of A076042 at its n-th low point.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4000 (Terms through a(42) from Giovanni Resta)
N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10001
maple: # Maple program from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 03 2019; guessb = A325056, guessc = A324791 (this sequence).
f := proc(k,M) local j1, twoL, RL, kprime, Mprime;
if issqr(j1) then lprint("Beware, perfect square: k,M,j1 are ",k,M,j1); fi;
mathematica: a=b=c=d=n=0; L={0}; While[Length[L] < 22, n++; a=b; b=c; c=d; d=c + If[c < n^2, n^2, -n^2]; If[a > b < c < d, AppendTo[L, b]]]; L (* _Giovanni Resta_, Oct 01 2019 *)
program: See _Tomas Rokicki_'s PARI program in A076042
xref: If we use primes instead of squares we get A008348, A309226, A324782, A324783.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 04 2019
